name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites- South Padre Island

reviews.title: Not a quiet hotel!
reviews.text: We did not have a good experience here. The first night we were here on March 7, 2008 and we heard LOUD screaming, horseplaying , cursing, running, knocking all night long! Our second day we came back to our hotel at around 5pm just to relax before dinner and there was LOUD arguing right outside our door, this went on for right about 15 minutes before WE decided to call downstairs and tell them at the desk, I am surprised they could not hear this fueding! Then when they sent some guy upstairs (3rd floor) to see what was going on I guess and that did no good at all so we decided to leave, we were tired and just wanted away from this atmosphere! We told Maria at the desk about our experience and she just simply said......well its spring break, they are going to be loud. Well I didnt care spring break or not, I paid for my room just like everyone else and I got a room so I could SLEEP and there is no chance for that here.......we werent the only ones either, we talked to other couples that were not "spring breakers" and they didnt get sleep either because the people running this place doesnt care about their "other" visitors and that is wrong. There should be some kind of rules.... such as no screaming after certain hours, I know its hard to control that many people but if you let them know you wont tolerate OUTRAGIOUS behavior then maybe some of it would stop. I also understand that kids are going to be kids.........I have 3 teenagers and I totally understand but this place was just a party joint just for kids! I will be taking this issue up with the main headquarters because this totally ruined my vacation, we came home today, March 9, 2008 because we were pretty much told this is spring break and thats just how it is and we (holiday inn express) cant make them be quiet. I know that they cant make them be "quiet" but they could have stopped some of the horseplaying, screaming and running that was going on ALL NIGHT LONG! but yet they made no effort! I lost money by coming home early but that was no relaxing vacation, I will never go back and definetly wont stay at the HOLIDAY INN EXPRESS chains anymore unless some how they make it up to me! I not only wasted my money on the hotel but our flights down there too and I had to pay $268 extra to change my flight to leave 2 days sooner. This by far was my worst vacation experience and I ve been to alot of places and I usually dont complain and its never been anything like this when I have. With all this said I will say that the room we stayed in was nice and clean and I wish that we could have stayed for the rest of our trip however we were not able to stay up 24/7 so we HAD to leave! They did offer us another room, they said not so many spring breakers were on the 4th floor so we went and checked it out and sure enough there was LOUD spring breakers right next to us and right across from us and while we were up there they were actually running out of their room to the room across from them(which was right next to us) and was throwing things (I think it was clothes or towels) NO THANKS! I would never recommend HOLIDAY INN EXPRESS if they cannot control their visitors! I am sorry to be so negative but I was very upset that MY vacation had to be changed because HOLIDAY INN EXPRESS needs to make some changes and wont!

I stayed in the hotel with my very old parents (+/- 80 y !) and we had a lovely time. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean with very nice rooms and the complementary breakfast was very good. The location of the hotel is perfect for a quiet vacation. We did long walks along the sea shore and rented bikes. We tried most of the restaurants in the area and had a wonderful vacation!
reviews.title: Very good value!

likes.liked: — The friendlieness of the hotel staff, the rooms, the surrounding.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived on Christmas Day (for six days) for our first visit and enjoyed the experience immensely. The hotel and staff were great and well informed. We had a spacious room and bath and comfortable bed. [My only complaint: While the rooms are very quiet, when guests left their rooms the slamming of their doors tended to reverberate throughout the whole hall.] We also enjoyed a mezzanine level for quiet reading, a short walk to beach and short driving distance to the 6 beach access roads. The breakfast staff was very efficient and kept the food available and tables cleared so--no waiting. EVERYONE we encountered in town (except the KFC staff) was friendly and went out of their way to answer questions, give tips on local stuff, guided us to places and activities not on our list, and just seemed to want us to enjoy our visit. If traveling with children, they will enjoy the turtle sanctuary across from the hotel and the Lighthouse and Treasures of the Gulf Museum in Port Isabella. We will return to SPI and the Holiday Inn Express---they represented their parent company well and we will look for this company in booking future travel..
reviews.title: Winter Holiday Visit

likes.liked: — helpful and friendly staff and managment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Being our second stay with this hotel, we pretty much knew what to expect. I booked a King room through our Priority Club account and were pleasantly surprised. Our suite was really spacious and very comfortable. Everything appeared to be very clean, and I am a stickler about that sort of thing. (I don't care if a place is older but there is no excuse for it not being clean, with the prices you have to pay these days.) We really didn't take advantage of the breakfast. My husband did go get a couple bagels one day and said they had a good variety of food available. The only down side,which was not a huge problem, was the fridge. It didn't seem to be get very cold until our last day. We could not find any way to adjust the temp either. Had we stayed longer, it would have been an issue and would have told management. Our experience was very good, just like our first visit. I would highly recommend this hotel and I have no doubt we will return to this hotel in the future.
reviews.title: Second time and still good experience

likes.liked: — Clean and short walk to beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for bike week. The room was very clean as well as the other areas of the hotel and pool. We had 2 small dogs and there is a special area outside for the pets to play and go to the bathroom.
reviews.title: Best hotel on the Island!!

reviews.text: This will be my 2nd visit to SPI and this hotel property. I decided to try something different but ended up back here again to finish out my stay and I wish I had stayed here all along. Whats not to like about this hotel? Modern, clean, spacious, well appointed, very good breakfast, clean rooms, excellent staff, competitive pricing -often lower than the area "resorts".
reviews.title: Undeniably the best choice for a nice comfortable clean stay

likes.liked: — Clean, newer, welll appointed, great rooms, excellent free breakfast
likes.disliked: — Isn't beach side but for business travelers and those avoiding spring break maddness that could be a blessing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Compared to the competition, Holiday Inn Express SPI is an oasis among older rundown spring break motels for the discriminating traveler.
reviews.title: We liked the hotel

reviews.text: The hotel didn't seem remarkably good or bad but much better than most around. It actually had a pretty good breakfast & we usually turn up our noses at hotel "continental" breakfasts. That is good because, much to my surprise, we couldn't find a decent restaurant on the island-and we love seafood and Mexican food. The room was large and clean but our view was the "wrong way", west. We were there before spring break so no noise.
reviews.title: Nice Stay
What a Holiday Inn
reviews.text: Booked this hotel for the group discount. It was located very close to the convention center which was nice. The beds were comfy and staff was very friendly. With the hotel being completely booked that weekend the pool was never over crowded which was great! The breakfast wasn't bad. The only complaint I had was the internet was down the whole time we were there. Would stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a business traveler and stay 80 nights per year in hotels.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the hotel this past weekend during Sand Castle Days. The facility was clean, neat, and well air-conditioned (with ceiling fans in the rooms, too). Staff was very friendly and eager to please. Breakfast buffet was well stocked. Fun to walk 2 blocks to beach for sunrise this morning. Pool was clean and had plenty of lounge chairs. Although this hotel is less than 2 years old, there are signs of wear already -- missing drawer pulls, shower curtain rod not very securely fastened to the wall, etc. Mostly, however, this is a very good place to stay for the price (we booked online through Orbitz and paid $156 total including all taxes and fees for two nights).
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay

likes.liked: — Clean, attractive and new in appearance
likes.disliked: — Some signs of wear and tear in guestroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We like staying at the La Quinta but they were full so tried out the newest hotel on SPI . Clean and - well, new! Breakfast was sufficient however, very crowded each morning. They didn't run out of food as far as I could tell and for that I'll give them credit. Beach access is 2 blocks from the hotel and if you are on the upper floor and on the back side you will have a beach view. I felt it was a bit pricey for not being on the beach and we had the Priority Club rate. There may have been better deals with travel agencies but didn't check. It is dog friendly as well.
reviews.title: Newest on the island

reviews.text: We made reservations for this Hotel before we found out about Hurricane Dean, but we are the adventurous type so we proceeded with our trip. Hurricane Dean never showed up!
reviews.title: Great Hotel at a Great Value

reviews.text: OK. The Hotel, The Holiday Inn Express is a great place to stay and a real value. It is located near the northern end of the Island near Andy Bowie Park. It is on the Gulf side but is not on the beach. The beach is about a block away and very short, convenient walk. We asked the front desk about an umbrella and chairs and were referred to a local company and when we got to the beach we were greeted with a smile, two chairs and an umbrella for $20 dollars. Great service.
reviews.title: Outstanding Customer Service

aka: Holiday Inn Express Hotel And Suites- South Padre Island
description: South Padre Island's newest and finest hotel, the Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites, invites you to travel Mexico & Texas in ONE VACATION to South Padre. You'll experience the white sand beaches and crystal blue waters of the Gulf of Mexico. As you enter our lobby, you will be immersed in tropical elegance. Check in will be a breeze as you and your family escape into our sea life - a 500 gallon aquarium. All our oversized rooms come with spectacular views of Laguna Madre Bay, Gulf of Mexico or our tropical poolside. If you're here for business, relax - we offer free wireless Internet in all public areas and high speed Internet access in every room as well as a complimentary full service business center. For the ultimate in convenience, all rooms have micro-fridges, coffee makers, dataport speaker phones and state-of-the art on demand movies/music and video games. Thanks to the latest technology, on demand movies can be paused/rewound so you'll never miss an important phone call. We are across the street from the Convention Center and close to championship golf, nightclubs, shopping centers and a variety of eateries. Visit Sea Turtle, Inc. or spend the day at Schlitterbahn Beach Water Park. The beach is just a short walk from your room where you can participate in deep sea fishing, horseback riding, parasailing, jet skiing or a local favorite - barbecuing on the beach. We are the perfect tropical getaway whether you're here for business or pleasure.
